poem:
Title: The Disquiet at Dawn

Duvets and chants meld in defiant fusion,
under the cold light of academia's disillusion. 
Uprising in the corridors, echoes of youthful commotion,
but the smell of sharp austerity seeps through each emotion. 
In the hall's pulsing heart, their dreams embattle,
on the brink of Easter - a different kind of shackle. 
Yet, even in its silence, the building reminds,
It's through discord, truth oft unwinds.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
